// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller): " for PvE Iâ€™d highly recommend bumping up the handling as much as possible. You can definitely spec out False Promises in a variety of different ways, and the higher base impact over other archetypes could mean end game potential (barring champion mods)." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,controller

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "In PvP 360s have never been the best choice; they were niche, unforgiving, and heavy. But False Promises with good handling and DSR could mean you barely miss shots and unrelenting can keep the streak going for longer." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller): "The Ikelos smg is back and thankfully we can add a touch of stability to make this gun less like a bucking bronco and more like an angry hedgehog. A high grenade build built upon Oppressive Darkness definitely comes to mind." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,controller

// Widow's Bite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller): "While I love the aesthetic of Veist weapons they all have been done before. Apostate, Twilight Oath, or even Omniscient Eye are all great PvP weapons with the ability for a good PvE roll. The Ikelos sniper has been reintroduced this season and just last season we got Distant Tumulus. The rapid-fire sniper rifle pool is so large compared to the aggressive frames. If this sniper were moved up two impact classes I could see it standing on its own, but Widowâ€™s Bite doesnâ€™t do anything remarkable that the aforementioned snipers canâ€™t do; and by now you already have a good roll on them." //notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "While I love the aesthetic of Veist weapons they all have been done before. Apostate, Twilight Oath, or even Omniscient Eye are all great PvP weapons with the ability for a good PvE roll. The Ikelos sniper has been reintroduced this season and just last season we got Distant Tumulus. The rapid-fire sniper rifle pool is so large compared to the aggressive frames. // The Forward Path
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "PvP is a different story with iron grip being added. Reload can be circumvented by a variety of ways and a slower reload never stopped people before. The +20 stability is massive and means that you could reliably invest in all range or handling over stability as that perk alone would cover a ton of your utility." Recommended MW: Handling or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Nature of the Beast
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller): "On controller this gun is a nice addition with quickdraw and dragonfly for something other precision frames lacked. But unfortunately youâ€™re just better off using a higher impact hand cannon. Both the recoil feels off on MnK and the damage is just too low for me to reliably recommend over the alternatives. Sunshot is a straight upgrade, Jack Queen King 3 has higher impact and can roll demolitionist alongside dragonfly and has the lightweight bonus. Itâ€™s not that Nature of the Beast is bad, it's more that other hand cannons are just better." Recommended MW: Reload.|tags:pve,controller

// Nature of the Beast
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "On controller this gun is a nice addition with quickdraw and dragonfly for something other precision frames lacked. But unfortunately youâ€™re just better off using a higher impact hand cannon. Both the recoil feels off on MnK and the damage is just too low for me to reliably recommend over the alternatives. Sunshot is a straight upgrade, Jack Queen King 3 has higher impact and can roll demolitionist alongside dragonfly and has the lightweight bonus. Itâ€™s not that Nature of the Beast is bad, it's more that other hand cannons are just better." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
